trans-unit.source: Activity: Marco Polo and Morse code
trans-unit.target: Activity: Marco Polo and Morse code

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/radio/marco-polo.png
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/radio/marco-polo.png

trans-unit.source: Marco Polo Cartoon
trans-unit.target: Marco Polo Cartoon

trans-unit.source: Guide the students in creating programs that use the radio communication blocks to send and receive data between two micro:bits.
trans-unit.target: Guide the students in creating programs that use the radio communication blocks to send and receive data between two micro:bits.

trans-unit.source: Notes:
trans-unit.target: 追加情報：

trans-unit.source: When using the radio blocks, the micro:bit simulator will show two micro:bits
trans-unit.target: When using the radio blocks, the micro:bit simulator will show two micro:bits

trans-unit.source: In the simulator, a radio transmission icon will appear in the top right corner of the micro:bit. The icon will light up as the micro:bit is transmitting data.
trans-unit.target: In the simulator, a radio transmission icon will appear in the top right corner of the micro:bit. The icon will light up as the micro:bit is transmitting data.

trans-unit.source: In the simulator, all the code in the coding workspace runs on both virtual micro:bits. You should include for how to send data as well as what to do when it receives data.
trans-unit.target: In the simulator, all the code in the coding workspace runs on both virtual micro:bits. You should include for how to send data as well as what to do when it receives data.

trans-unit.source: Marco Polo
trans-unit.target: Marco Polo

trans-unit.source: Send and receive strings between micro:bits. On button A pressed, we will send the string Marco and on button B pressed we will send the string Polo.
trans-unit.target: Send and receive strings between micro:bits. On button A pressed, we will send the string Marco and on button B pressed we will send the string Polo.

trans-unit.source: When communicating between micro:bits, it is important that the micro:bits involved are all using the same group ID. So, the first thing we will do is set the group ID number.
trans-unit.target: When communicating between micro:bits, it is important that the micro:bits involved are all using the same group ID. So, the first thing we will do is set the group ID number.

trans-unit.source: From the Radio menu, drag a 'radio set group' block to the coding workspace and place the block into the on start block.
trans-unit.target: From the Radio menu, drag a 'radio set group' block to the coding workspace and place the block into the on start block.

trans-unit.source: In the 'radio set group block', leave the default value of 1 for the group ID
trans-unit.target: In the 'radio set group block', leave the default value of 1 for the group ID

trans-unit.source: radio.setGroup(1)
trans-unit.target: radio.setGroup(1)

trans-unit.source: Drag 2 'on button pressed' blocks to the coding workspace
trans-unit.target: Drag 2 'on button pressed' blocks to the coding workspace

trans-unit.source: Leave one with the default value A and change the other button to B
trans-unit.target: Leave one with the default value A and change the other button to B

trans-unit.source: From the Radio Toolbox drawer, drag 2 'radio send string' blocks to the coding workspace
trans-unit.target: From the Radio Toolbox drawer, drag 2 'radio send string' blocks to the coding workspace

trans-unit.source: Place one 'radio send string' block into the 'on button A pressed' block, and the other'radio send string' block into the 'on button B pressed' block
trans-unit.target: Place one 'radio send string' block into the 'on button A pressed' block, and the other'radio send string' block into the 'on button B pressed' block

trans-unit.source: In the 'on button A pressed' block, change the default empty string value of the 'radio send string' block to the string "Marco"
trans-unit.target: In the 'on button A pressed' block, change the default empty string value of the 'radio send string' block to the string "Marco"

trans-unit.source: In the 'on button B pressed' block, change the default empty string value of the 'radio send string' block to the string "Polo"
trans-unit.target: In the 'on button B pressed' block, change the default empty string value of the 'radio send string' block to the string "Polo"

trans-unit.source: To display the data sent between the micro:bits, drag an 'on radio received receivedString' block to the coding workspace
trans-unit.target: To display the data sent between the micro:bits, drag an 'on radio received receivedString' block to the coding workspace

trans-unit.source: From the Basic Toolbox drawer, drag a 'show string' block into the 'on radio received receivedString' block
trans-unit.target: From the Basic Toolbox drawer, drag a 'show string' block into the 'on radio received receivedString' block

trans-unit.source: From the Variables Toolbox drawer, drag a 'receivedString' variable block into the default string value of "Hello" in the 'show string' block
trans-unit.target: From the Variables Toolbox drawer, drag a 'receivedString' variable block into the default string value of "Hello" in the 'show string' block

trans-unit.source: Here is the complete Marco Polo program:
trans-unit.target: Here is the complete Marco Polo program:

trans-unit.source: Mods
trans-unit.target: Mods

trans-unit.source: Add a 'show leds' block to the 'on start' block. We created an image of the initials MP.
trans-unit.target: Add a 'show leds' block to the 'on start' block. We created an image of the initials MP.

trans-unit.source: From the Music Toolbox drawer, drag 2 'play tone' blocks to the coding workspace.
trans-unit.target: From the Music Toolbox drawer, drag 2 'play tone' blocks to the coding workspace.

trans-unit.source: See hack your headphones for how to connect a speaker or headphones to the micro:bit.
trans-unit.target: See hack your headphones for how to connect a speaker or headphones to the micro:bit.

trans-unit.source: Drag one of the 'play tone' blocks to the 'on button A pressed' block, and the other one to the 'on button B pressed' block.
trans-unit.target: Drag one of the 'play tone' blocks to the 'on button A pressed' block, and the other one to the 'on button B pressed' block.

trans-unit.source: Change the default value in the 'play tone' block that is inside the 'on button A pressed' block to the value Low C.
trans-unit.target: Change the default value in the 'play tone' block that is inside the 'on button A pressed' block to the value Low C.

trans-unit.source: Complete Marco Polo program with mods:
trans-unit.target: Complete Marco Polo program with mods:

trans-unit.source: Morse Code
trans-unit.target: Morse Code

trans-unit.source: Send and receive numbers between micro:bits.
trans-unit.target: Send and receive numbers between micro:bits.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the button pressed, send a different number value between micro:bits.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the button pressed, send a different number value between micro:bits.

trans-unit.source: On receiving a number, display a different image unique to the number sent.
trans-unit.target: On receiving a number, display a different image unique to the number sent.

trans-unit.source: One number will represent a dot, another a dash and another a space or stop.
trans-unit.target: One number will represent a dot, another a dash and another a space or stop.

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/radio/morse.png
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/radio/morse.png

trans-unit.source: Morse code alphabet
trans-unit.target: Morse code alphabet

trans-unit.source: Set the group ID number.
trans-unit.target: Set the group ID number.

trans-unit.source: Add a 'show string' block to the 'on start' block, to identify the program.
trans-unit.target: Add a 'show string' block to the 'on start' block, to identify the program.

trans-unit.source: We choose to change the default string value of "Hello" to the value "Morse Code"
trans-unit.target: We choose to change the default string value of "Hello" to the value "Morse Code"

trans-unit.source: radio.setGroup(1) basic.showString("Morse Code")
trans-unit.target: radio.setGroup(1) basic.showString("Morse Code")

trans-unit.source: Drag 3 'on button pressed' blocks to the coding workspace.
trans-unit.target: Drag 3 'on button pressed' blocks to the coding workspace.

trans-unit.source: Leave one with the default value A, change the value in the second block to B, and change the value in the third block to A+B.
trans-unit.target: Leave one with the default value A, change the value in the second block to B, and change the value in the third block to A+B.

trans-unit.source: From the Radio Toolbox drawer, drag 3 'radio send number' blocks to the coding workspace.
trans-unit.target: From the Radio Toolbox drawer, drag 3 'radio send number' blocks to the coding workspace.

trans-unit.source: Place one radio send number block into each of the 'on button pressed' blocks.
trans-unit.target: Place one radio send number block into each of the 'on button pressed' blocks.

trans-unit.source: In the 'on button A pressed' block, leave the default number value of the 'radio send number' block as 0.
trans-unit.target: In the 'on button A pressed' block, leave the default number value of the 'radio send number' block as 0.

trans-unit.source: In the 'on button B pressed' block, change the default number value of the 'radio send number' block to the value 1.
trans-unit.target: In the 'on button B pressed' block, change the default number value of the 'radio send number' block to the value 1.

trans-unit.source: In the 'on button A+B pressed' block, change the default number value of the 'radio send number' block to the value 2.
trans-unit.target: In the 'on button A+B pressed' block, change the default number value of the 'radio send number' block to the value 2.

trans-unit.source: From the Radio Toolbox drawer, drag an 'on radio received receivedNumber' event handler to the coding workspace.
trans-unit.target: From the Radio Toolbox drawer, drag an 'on radio received receivedNumber' event handler to the coding workspace.

trans-unit.source: Since we will display a different image depending on the number value received, we need a logic block.
trans-unit.target: Since we will display a different image depending on the number value received, we need a logic block.

trans-unit.source: From the Logic Toolbox drawer, drag an 'if...then' block to the coding workspace and place it in the 'on radio received receivedNumber' event handler.
trans-unit.target: From the Logic Toolbox drawer, drag an 'if...then' block to the coding workspace and place it in the 'on radio received receivedNumber' event handler.

trans-unit.source: In order to know whether to display a dot, a dash, or a space/stop image, we need to compare the number received to the values 0, 1, and 2.
trans-unit.target: In order to know whether to display a dot, a dash, or a space/stop image, we need to compare the number received to the values 0, 1, and 2.

trans-unit.source: From the Logic Toolbox drawer, drag a 0=0 comparison block into the coding workspace.
trans-unit.target: From the Logic Toolbox drawer, drag a 0=0 comparison block into the coding workspace.

trans-unit.source: Replace the default value 'true' of the 'if...then' block with the comparison block.
trans-unit.target: Replace the default value 'true' of the 'if...then' block with the comparison block.

trans-unit.source: From the Variables Toolbox drawer, drag a 'receivedNumber' variable block into the coding workspace, and drop it into the first slot of the comparison block
trans-unit.target: From the Variables Toolbox drawer, drag a 'receivedNumber' variable block into the coding workspace, and drop it into the first slot of the comparison block

trans-unit.source: Leave the righthand side default value of zero in the 0=0 block.
trans-unit.target: Leave the righthand side default value of zero in the 0=0 block.

trans-unit.source: Place a 'show leds' block in the space after the then of the 'if...then' block.
trans-unit.target: Place a 'show leds' block in the space after the then of the 'if...then' block.

trans-unit.source: Create an image to represent a dot.
trans-unit.target: Create an image to represent a dot.

trans-unit.source: Try it!
trans-unit.target: Try it!

trans-unit.source: Download your program to the micro:bit
trans-unit.target: Download your program to the micro:bit

trans-unit.source: Press button A on the sending micro:bit
trans-unit.target: Press button A on the sending micro:bit

trans-unit.source: Does this cause a dot to be displayed on the receiving micro:bit?
trans-unit.target: Does this cause a dot to be displayed on the receiving micro:bit?

trans-unit.source: However, pressing button A again does not appear to send another dot as the image on the receiving micro:bit does not appear to change.
trans-unit.target: However, pressing button A again does not appear to send another dot as the image on the receiving micro:bit does not appear to change.

trans-unit.source: Challenge question: How can we fix this?
trans-unit.target: Challenge question: How can we fix this?

trans-unit.source: Add a 'pause' block and a 'clear screen' block after the 'show leds' block
trans-unit.target: Add a 'pause' block and a 'clear screen' block after the 'show leds' block

trans-unit.source: Try running the program again. Now each time the sender presses button A, you see a dot appear.
trans-unit.target: Try running the program again. Now each time the sender presses button A, you see a dot appear.

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/radio/microbit-dot-display.png
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/radio/microbit-dot-display.png

trans-unit.source: micro:bit dot display
trans-unit.target: micro:bit dot display

trans-unit.source: You can now right-click on the 'if…then' block and select Duplicate to copy that piece of code twice for the other 2 values that a sender may send.
trans-unit.target: You can now right-click on the 'if…then' block and select Duplicate to copy that piece of code twice for the other 2 values that a sender may send.

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/radio/if-then-duplicate.png
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/radio/if-then-duplicate.png

trans-unit.source: If-block, right-click and duplicate
trans-unit.target: If-block, right-click and duplicate

trans-unit.source: Change the values on the righthand side of the comparison block to 1, and 2.
trans-unit.target: Change the values on the righthand side of the comparison block to 1, and 2.

trans-unit.source: Modify the images displayed to show a dash, and a full screen of lights
trans-unit.target: Modify the images displayed to show a dash, and a full screen of lights

trans-unit.source: Morse code program
trans-unit.target: Morse code program

trans-unit.source: `) basic.pause(100) basic.clearScreen() } if (receivedNumber == 1) { basic.showLeds(` .
trans-unit.target: `) basic.pause(100) basic.clearScreen() } if (receivedNumber == 1) { basic.showLeds(` .

trans-unit.source: Try it!
trans-unit.target: Try it!

trans-unit.source: Download your program to the micro:bit
trans-unit.target: Download your program to the micro:bit

trans-unit.source: Press buttons A, B, and A+B together on the micro:bit
trans-unit.target: Press buttons A, B, and A+B together on the micro:bit

trans-unit.source: Challenge question: Can our code be made more efficient?
trans-unit.target: Challenge question: Can our code be made more efficient?

trans-unit.source: Whenever you look over a program and see the same lines of code repeated, there is usually a chance to improve the code making it more efficient by reducing the number of lines of code
trans-unit.target: Whenever you look over a program and see the same lines of code repeated, there is usually a chance to improve the code making it more efficient by reducing the number of lines of code

trans-unit.source: What lines are repeated in our program? If...then, pause, clear screen
trans-unit.target: What lines are repeated in our program? If...then, pause, clear screen

trans-unit.source: Can we edit the code to use only one 'if...then' block, one 'pause' block, and one 'clear screen' block? Yes!
trans-unit.target: Can we edit the code to use only one 'if...then' block, one 'pause' block, and one 'clear screen' block? Yes!

trans-unit.source: Making our code more efficient
trans-unit.target: Making our code more efficient

trans-unit.source: Remind students that they can edit the 'if...then' block, adding as many 'else if' conditions as needed.
trans-unit.target: Remind students that they can edit the 'if...then' block, adding as many 'else if' conditions as needed.

trans-unit.source: They can do this by clicking on the blue gear-wheel icon in the top left corner of the 'if...then' block.
trans-unit.target: They can do this by clicking on the blue gear-wheel icon in the top left corner of the 'if...then' block.

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/radio/if-then-else-if.png
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/radio/if-then-else-if.png

trans-unit.source: Add else-if to if-then block
trans-unit.target: Add else-if to if-then block

trans-unit.source: A final else In a conditional that might receive a number of different values, it is good coding practice to have a catch-all 'else' clause.
trans-unit.target: A final else In a conditional that might receive a number of different values, it is good coding practice to have a catch-all 'else' clause.

trans-unit.source: In our example, if any number value other than the ones we coded for (0,1, and 2) is received, we can signal the user that an error has occurred by using a 'show icon' block to display an X.
trans-unit.target: In our example, if any number value other than the ones we coded for (0,1, and 2) is received, we can signal the user that an error has occurred by using a 'show icon' block to display an X.

trans-unit.source: The pause and clear screen Rather than repeat these lines of code 3 times, we can move the 'pause' block and the 'clear screen' block outside of the edited 'if...then…else' block.
trans-unit.target: The pause and clear screen Rather than repeat these lines of code 3 times, we can move the 'pause' block and the 'clear screen' block outside of the edited 'if...then…else' block.

trans-unit.source: Now our program runs as we designed it to run and is more efficient, too!
trans-unit.target: Now our program runs as we designed it to run and is more efficient, too!

trans-unit.source: Final Morse Code Program:
trans-unit.target: Final Morse Code Program:

trans-unit.source: radio
trans-unit.target: 無線
